de.polygonal.ds.BinaryTreeNode

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A binary tree that is formed by connecting binary tree nodes together.

Constructor

new(x : T)
Creates a new node storing x.

Instance Variables

l : BinaryTreeNode<T>

The left child node.

p : BinaryTreeNode<T>

The parent node.

r : BinaryTreeNode<T>

The right child node.

val : T

The node value.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Recursively clears this tree by deleting all child nodes underneath this node.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this binary tree.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this tree formed by this node and all connected nodes contains the element x.

depth() : Int

Calculates the depth of this node which is the length of the path from the root node to this node. The root node is at depth zero.

hasL() : Bool

Returns true if this node has a left child.

hasR() : Bool

Returns true if this node has a right child.

height() : Int

The height of a tree is the length of the path from the root to the deepest node in the tree. A tree with only a root node has a height of one.

inorder(?process : BinaryTreeNode<T> -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?iterative : Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
process Alternative to visit() if elements don't implement Visitable.
iterative Uses an iterative inorder implementation.
userData Optional user data that is passed to every visited node.
Performs a recursive inorder traversal by calling visit on every element provided that all elements implement the Visitable interface:

  • Traverse the left subtree
  • Visit the node
  • Traverse the right subtree

If process is specified, element.visit() is ignored and process is used instead. The traversal runs as long as visit() returns true; once visit() returns false (or all elements have been visited) the traversal is stopped immediately.

isEmpty() : Bool

Always returns false.

isL() : Bool

Returns true if this node is a left child relative to the parent node.

isR() : Bool

Returns true if this node is a right child relative to the parent node.

isRoot() : Bool

Returns true if this node is a root node (has no parent).

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this tree (including this).

postorder(?process : BinaryTreeNode<T> -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?iterative : Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
process Alternative to visit() if elements don't implement Visitable.
iterative Uses an iterative postorder implementation.
userData Optional user data that is passed to every visited node.
Performs a recursive postorder traversal by calling visit on every element provided that all elements implement the Visitable interface:

  • Traverse the left subtree
  • Traverse the right subtree
  • Visit the node

If process is specified, element.visit() is ignored and process is used instead. The traversal runs as long as visit() returns true; once visit() returns false (or all elements have been visited) the traversal is stopped immediately.

preorder(?process : BinaryTreeNode<T> -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?iterative : Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
process Alternative to visit() if elements don't implement Visitable.
iterative Uses an iterative preorder implementation.
userData Optional user data that is passed to every visited node.
Performs a recursive preorder traversal by calling visit on every element provided that all elements implement the Visitable interface:

  • Visit the node
  • Traverse the left subtree
  • Traverse the right subtree

If process is specified, element.visit() is ignored and process is used instead. The traversal runs as long as visit() returns true; once visit() returns false (or all elements have been visited) the traversal is stopped immediately.

setL(x : T) : Void

Adds a left child to this node storing x.

setR(x : T) : Void

Adds a right child to this node storing x.

size() : Int

Recursively counts the number of nodes in this tree (including this).

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array ordered by the preorder rule. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector ordered by the preorder rule. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
